content: Long Cheng @ Clemson Long Cheng @ Clemson â° Ã Home Research Publications Teaching Awards Service Group Long Cheng, Ph.D. Associate Professor School of Computing Clemson University Clemson, SC 29634 Email: lcheng2@clemson.edu Office: McAdams 210 Google Scholar News [Paper] 06/2025: Jingwen's paper on App Account Deletion was accepted by USENIX Security, 2025. [Paper] 03/2025: Ebuka had another paper accepted by the International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media (ICWSM), 2025. [Service] 01/2025: Joined IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing (TDSC)'s editorial board and ACM Digital Threats: Research and Practice (DTRAP)'s editorial board as associate editor. Serve as a Program Co-Chair for the 3rd EAI International Conference on Security and Privacy in Cyber-Physical Systems and Smart Vehicles (SmartSP 2025). Please submit your work! [Grant] 01/2025: Received grant from Clemson TraCR Program (as PI). [Paper] 01/2025: One paper on Software Vulnerability Patching Using LLMs was accepted by USENIX Security, 2025. [Grant] 01/2025: Received two grants from Clemson VIPR-GS Program (as Co-PI). [Grant] 12/2024: Received a seed grant from Clemson Media Forensics Hub (as PI). [Paper] 09/2024: Jingwen and Song's paper on Acoustic Privacy Notice for Voice Applications was accepted by Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS), 2025. [Paper] 07/2024: Ebuka's paper on Analyzing Offensive Content and Emotional Dynamics of Tweets was accepted by the International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media (ICWSM), 2025. [Paper] 07/2024: Song's paper on understanding Security and Privacy Risks in the RapidAPI Ecosystem was accepted by ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), 2024. [Paper] 07/2024: Mo's paper on User Review Analysis was accepted by ACM Interactive, Mobile, Wearable, and Ubiquitous Technologies (IMWUT/UBICOMP) (UbiComp), 2024. [Student] 06/2024: Ebuka passed the PhD dissertation defense, and will join Apple Siri group. Congratulations! [Student] 06/2024: Song passed the PhD dissertation defense, and will join the Department of Computer Science at Texas Tech University as a Tenure-Track Assistant Professor in Fall 2024. Congratulations! [Award] 05/2024: Received Tenure & Promotion letter, and Deanâs Professorship Award! [Paper] 01/2024: One paper on GDPR compliance in privacy policies of Alexa skills was accepted by The Web Conference (WWW), 2024. [Paper] 12/2023: One survey paper on network attack surface mapping was accepted by ACM Digital Threats: Research and Practice (DTRAP), 2024. [Paper] 10/2023: One paper about using LLMs/Chain-of-Thought (CoT) to mitigate the spread of hate speech was accepted by IEEE Symposium on Security & Privacy (S&P), 2024. [Grant] 08/2023: Our project “Efficient, Cybersecure and Safe EV Operations in the Clemson Smart City Testbed” was funded by Innova EV and South Carolina Research Authority (as PI). [Paper] 08/2023: One paper on Detecting Bugs in Python Runtimes was accepted by ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), 2023. [Paper] 07/2023: One paper about our AI-based Cyberharassment Detection Labs was accepted by IEEE/ASEE Frontiers in Education Conference, 2023. Check out the AI-Cybersecurity Lab. [Outreach] 07/2023: We presented two lectures about cyberbully detection on images and debiasing word embeddings in GenCyber Summer Post-Camp at North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University (NC A&T). [Grant] 07/2023: Honored to receive an NSF CAREER Award! [Grant] 07/2023: Our center project “National University Transportation Center: TraCR” was funded by USDOT (as Co-PI). [Paper] 05/2023: One paper on Static Analysis of Voice Applications was accepted by ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), 2023. [Paper] 05/2023: One paper on Offensive Tweet Analysis was accepted by ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD), Applied Data Science (ADS) track, 2023. [Grant] 05/2023: Received a seed grant from US Army VIPR-GS Program (as Co-PI). [Student] 05/2023: Ebuka started summer internship at Apple, Tsu-Yao started summer internship at Amazon, and Song started summer visit at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University. Doug passed the PhD dissertation defense. Congratulations! [Service] Serve on the TPC of ACSAC 2023, as a Publicity Co-Chair for IEEE SecDev 2023. Please submit your work! [Grant] 01/2023: Received a grant from the MIT Lincoln Laboratory (as Co-PI). [Paper] 10/2022: One paper on Multi-Language Fuzzing was accepted by USENIX Security, 2023. [Paper] 10/2022: One paper was accepted by The Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP), 2022. [Grant] 08/2022: NSF grant from SAI program (as Lead PI). [Award] 05/2022: Our paper received Best Paper Award at ACM AsiaCCS 2022. [Student] 05/2022: Ebuka started summer internship with the Siri Home Automation Team at Apple. [Service] Serve on the TPC of ACSAC 2022, as a Publicity Co-Chair for IEEE SecDev 2022. Please submit your work! [Paper] 02/2022: One paper on IoT Security was accepted by ACM AsiaCCS 2022. [Paper] 12/2021: One paper on photo privacy was accepted by ACM CODASPY 2022. [Tutorial] 10/2021: We presented a tutorial titiled Investigating Advanced Exploits for System Security Assurance at IEEE SecDev 2021. [Slides] [Code] [Paper] 08/2021: One paper on Policy-Violation Detection of Voice Assistant Applications was accepted by USENIX Security, 2022. [Talk] 07/2021: We presented our work on Policy-Violation Detection of Voice Assistant Applications at the FTC's PrivacyCon 2021. [Award] 05/2021: Google awarded us a bug bounty for reporting various policy-violating Google Actions. [Paper] 05/2021: One paper on Privacy Policy Analysis of Voice Assistant Applications was accepted by IEEE Security & Privacy Magazine (invited), 2021. [Grant] 05/2021: NSF grant from SaTC-EDU program (as Lead PI). [Paper] 04/2021: One paper on Memory Corruption Attacks and Defenses was accepted by the ACM Transactions on Privacy and Security, 2021. [Service] 03/2021: Serve as a Publicy Chair for IEEE Secure Development Conference (SecDev 2021). Please submit your work! [Paper] 03/2021: One paper on Deep Learning-based Binary Code Similarity Detection was accepted by IEEE/IFIP International Conference on Dependable Systems and Networks (DSN), 2021. [Paper] 02/2021: One survey paper on Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection in Cyber-Physical Systems was accepted by the ACM Computing Surveys, 2021. [Paper] 12/2020: One paper on Visual Cyberbullying Detection was accepted by Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS) 2021. [Paper] 12/2020: One paper on IoT Cyber-Physical Security was accepted by Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS) 2021. [Award] 12/2020: Our paper received Distinguished Paper Award at the Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC) 2020. [Award] 12/2020: Google awarded us an Abuse Research Grant to support our research in abuse risks in Google products. [Paper] 10/2020: One paper on Secure LoRa Communications was accepted by ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems (SenSys) 2020. [Paper] 09/2020: One paper on Trustworthiness of Skill Certification in Voice Personal Assistant Platforms was accepted by ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), 2020. [Paper] 08/2020: One paper on Privacy Policy Analysis for Voice Assistant Applications was accepted by The Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC) 2020. [Talk] 08/2020: We presented our work on Trustworthiness of Skill Certification in Voice Personal Assistant Platforms at the FTC's PrivacyCon 2020. [Award] 08/2020: Google awarded us another bug bounty for discovering abuse risks of Google Actions. [Paper] 07/2020: One paper on IoT Traffic Privacy Leakage Analysis was accepted by IEEE Internet of Things Journal, 2020. [Media] 07/2020: The Register and some others reported our work on measuring the ineffectiveness of privacy policies for voice-apps. [Award] 07/2020: Google awarded us $5,000 bug bounty for discovering vulnerabilities of Google Actions. [Media] 07/2020: The Register, Washington Internet Daily, ZDNet and some others reported our work on measuring the trustworthiness of Alexa's skills certification. [Service] 06/2020: Serve on the TPC of IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM 2021). [Grant] 06/2020: NSF grant from RAPID program (as Co-PI). [Paper] 02/2020: Two papers on IoT Security were accepted by ACM AsiaCCS 2020. [Service] Serve on the TPC of Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC 2020). [Service] Serve on the TPC of IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (IEEE CNS 2020). [Paper] One paper was accepted by IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications (TWC). [Paper] One paper on Edge Computing was accepted by IEEE/ACM IWQoS 2019. [Paper] One paper on Blockchain was accepted by IEEE ICDCS 2019. [Paper] One paper on CPS Security was accepted by IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing (TDSC). [Media] TechXplore's report on our work on data-oriented attacks and defenses. More… Group Members Current Graduate Students Jeffrey Young CS PhD Student, MS from Georgia Southern University. 2019 Fall - John Anderson CS PhD Candidate, MS from College of Charleston. 2021 Spring - Mohammed Aldeen CS PhD Student, BS from Zhejiang University of Technology. 2022 Fall - Jingwen Yan CS PhD Student, MS from University of Pittsburgh. 2023 Fall - Jin Ma CS PhD Student, BS/MS from XJTU. 2023 Fall - Shuhao Zhang CS PhD Student, MS from University of Florida. 2023 Fall - Andrew York CS PhD Student, MS from Clemson University. 2024 Summer - Kenneth Roulier CS PhD Student, MS from Clemson University. 2024 Spring - Christopher Salas CS PhD Student, BS from Florida State University. 2025 Summer - Sravani Chinni CS PhD Student, MS from Clemson University. 2025 Fall - Alumni Song Liao CS
